item.description: Former New Zealand prime minister Jacinda Ardern has moved to Australia.

item.title: Wieambilla home where three innocent people shot dead put up for sale
item.description: The house at 251 Wains Road, Wieambilla, is where Gareth, Stacey and Nathaniel Train engaged in a three-hour shootout with police, killing constables Matthew Arnold and Rachel McCrow in late 2022.

item.title: Driver's dilemma after e-bike damages their car on Sydney street
item.description: "Why are they allowed to park blocking footpaths again?"﻿﻿

item.title: Two dead, four seriously ill after fungal infection cluster at major Sydney hospital
item.description: The fungus forced an entire ward of the hospital to be shut down.

item.title: Sydney man taken in brazen alleged kidnapping recovered in covert police operation
item.description: The search is on for several alleged kidnappers tonight.

item.title: 20 million-year-old whale fossil excavated from Victorian beach after family's rare find
item.description: A 20 million-year-old whale fossil has been excavated from a Victorian beach after it was discovered by a family from Queensland late last year.

item.title: SA coroner urges lifejacket reforms after eight deaths
item.description: South Australian coroner David Whittle says "prudent" offshore fishermen should consider equipping their lifejackets with GPS-enabled personal locator beacons.

item.title: Queenslanders warned to brace for possible 'cyclone sandwich'
item.description: Records are tumbling in outback Queensland, as days of rain cut off communities and interrupts supply chains, sending regional residents scrambling to ensure they have what they need to get them through the big wet.

item.title: Clock ticks down as Trump's threat to Iran nears crunch time
item.description: E﻿ven the massive American military force assembled around Iran may not be enough to force out its regime, one expert warns.

item.title: Today in History - February 27: Glasses found in a sealed envelope sparks court case
item.description: A pair of glasses found in an envelope in a small town courthouse on February 27, 1980, sparked a high-profile trial over their ownership.

item.title: Raymond Reddington convicted of wife's murder in 40-year-old cold case, as sons plead to know where mum's body
item.description: The couple's sons are calling on their dad to reveal where their mum's remains are so they can give her "the respectful burial she deserves".

item.title: Thieves swipe $40,000 of rescue gear from SES depot
item.description: T﻿he group of four broke into the Melbourne facility at 1am before two returned later for a second go.

item.title: Sydney lawyer allegedly stole nearly $15 million from clients
item.description: I﻿t will be alleged in court the man stole the money from business and trust accounts for gambling.

item.title: Police video shows Vince McMahon's 160kmph car crash
item.description: I﻿t happened as the former WWE executive was being followed by a state trooper.

item.title: Sussan Ley's parting shot to Angus Taylor as she leaves politics after 25 years
item.description: In a statement on Friday morning, Ley announced she had tendered her resignation, effective immediately﻿.﻿

item.title: 'Serious concerns': Urgent appeal to find missing 73-year-old woman
item.description: Yvonne Whear, 73, was last spotted at the Shell Service Station on Tweed Valley Way at Murwillumbah at about 3.15pm on February 19.

item.title: Karina parked the 'safest' way but still copped a fine. Now it's been wiped without explanation
item.description: K﻿arina parked rear to kerb, which experts agree is the safest way to do it. She still copped a $140 fine.

item.title: Company behind Australian cultural icon Hills Hoist could soon be sold
item.description: The company behind one of Australia's most iconic brands is set to be put up for sale as its American owner focuses on operations closer to home.

item.title: Bystanders tackle driver after car hits pedestrians, takes out wall
item.description: Bystanders tackled the driver to the ground after the car ploughed into a brick wall outside a busy train station.

item.title: Man falls two metres down flooded drain as torrential rain lashes Sydney
item.description: He was hospitalised with several broken bones.

item.title: Nine childcare centres face suspension or funding cuts after failing to meet standards
item.description: M﻿ore than 60 centres have been on noticed since August after having failed to meet minimum standards for seven or more years.

item.title: Rebel Wilson court woes could drag into next year
item.description: Lawyers for Wilson made an application in the Federal Court today to move defamation proceedings against her to the NSW Supreme Court.

item.title: Chaos for passengers after international flight diverted from Sydney to Canberra
item.description: T﻿he Air India flight was supposed to touch down in Sydney at 7pm but passengers claim they didn't disembark in Canberra until after midnight.

item.title: Popular toy pulled from Kmart shelves over safety concerns
item.description: ﻿Kmart found the toy poses a risk of serious injury or death from choking.

item.title: Almost 40,000 Budget Direct customers allegedly overcharged $3.3 million
item.description: Australia's financial watchdog has taken legal action against the insurer behind the Budget Direct products.

item.title: Killer's kids vow to forgive but not forget their mother's death
item.description: Lise Muliaga's five young children had every reason to fall apart after her death. But two-and-a-half years on, their son showed compassion to their killer father.

item.title: Hundreds of Australians potentially impacted as tech giant axes 4000 jobs globally
item.description: "Repeated rounds of cuts are destructive to morale, to focus, and to the trust that customers and shareholders place in our ability to lead."

item.title: Are Friday night drinks a distant memory? How work-from-home and the four-day work week is hitting CBD cafes a
item.description: Pubs, cafes, restaurants and bars in Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane's city centres ﻿are grappling with a steady decline of customers as the weekend looms, owed in part to workers choosing to work remotely.

item.title: Government won't rule out changes to negative gearing
item.description: Jim Chalmers has effectively confirmed Treasury has looked into the impact of limiting one of Australia's most contentious tax breaks for property investors.

item.title: Sinkhole causes chaos at nearby school, businesses in Sydney CBD
item.description: Meanwhile, a shark warning has been issued as the city recovers from a burst of severe rain and flash flooding.

item.title: Parents charged with domestic violence manslaughter of three-year-old son
item.description: The parents of a three-year-old boy who died in the foyer of a Queensland police station following a car crash on the Gold Coast last year have been charged with manslaughter and drug trafficking.

item.title: Fire inside Yallourn Power Station contained after five hours
item.description: Firefighters have spent nearly five hours battling to control a blaze inside one of Victoria's largest power stations.

item.title: Australian tourist dies in Thailand after alleged assault
item.description: I﻿t is unclear what caused the alleged assault to occur

item.title: Former US president Bill Clinton had no knowledge of Epstein crimes, says Hillary Clinton
item.description: The former US secretary of state and first lady was standing by her husband Bill Clinton at the end of a six-hour deposition.

item.title: From road closures to parades: Everything you need to know about Sydney Mardi Gras 2026
item.description: Partygoers from across the nation will rush to the city to watch more than 9000 marchers and about 170 floats take to the street in the iconic Mardi Gras parade.

item.title: Victorian teens to face life in prison for violent crimes as new law enforced
item.description: Maximum jail terms for Victorian children aged 14 and over who commit violent crimes will surge from three years to 25 years.

item.title: VB pins hopes on mid-strength as Aussies drop classic beers
item.description: T﻿he newly-unveiled mid-strength brew signals a growing trend across Australia as illustrated by the sales numbers.

item.title: Dangerous conditions feared as Adelaide braces for major deluge
item.description: T﻿he expected drenching comes after one of the city's driest summers on record.

item.title: Man charged with allegedly planning terrorist attack on multiple locations in Perth
item.description: A 20-year-old man has been charged after allegedly planning a terrorist attack on multiple political and religious sites in Perth.

item.title: Teen dies after being hit by two cars in Perth after getting off bus to go to school
item.description: A family is grieving the death of their teenage son after a school commute turned to tragedy in Perth's south.

item.title: 'This one hurts': Rolling Loud Australia announces cancellation of festival
item.description: "Unfortunately, our local partner, Primuse Entertainment, failed to meet critical deadlines and related obligations."

item.title: 'These words are hard to write': Celine Cremer's family confirm DNA test results after remains found
item.description: C﻿eline Cremer vanished three years ago after starting a bushwalk in remote Tasmania.

item.title: With only three women left, an Amazon tribe faced extinction. An unexpected birth now brings hope
item.description: Akyp's arrival brought hope not just for the Akuntsu line but also for efforts to protect the equally fragile rainforest.
